cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 150 miles SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwestward toward the Yucatan Peninsula, then north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico aiming for the Louisiana Gulf Coast late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Vermilion Bay-Atchafalaya Delta area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast eastward across the entire Louisiana coastline and adjacent Mississippi/Alabama shores
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Friday, especially if the center tracks near the TX-LA border.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push water levels 2–4 ft above ground along Sabine Lake and adjacent bays, locally higher if the center shifts west.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–6 inches of rain Friday into early Saturday with localized higher totals causing flash-flooding around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and elevated river levels may disrupt vessel traffic and terminal operations before and after landfall.
